author: Phil Lewis
title: DARP: Cardano Address Name Service
description: Developers need ways to manage addresses in their dApps, for user experience and backend integrations (e.g. smart contracts, NFT data)

assessments.note: simplified address will certainly help the blockchain adoption but IMHO the processus should add a simplification "in wallet" to do it , so Grandma can do it and send her adress to her friends.
A Cardano naming service similar to ENS is not a developer resource at all. Never made clear how this solution will have a positive impact on Cardano developer ecosystem.

Nothing in this proposal speak to the Cardano developer ecosystem, it all speaks to an ENS like application for end users to have wallet names. Why is this proposal in this category if the target user is not developers?
This not a developer tool if its for end user wallet addresses built on top of Prism

A thoroughly though out proposal that addresses one of the major pain points, not only for devs migrating addresses or processing things but also for the overall user experience of the entire ecosystem. It is definitely not a sexy project, but would make major improvements to help drive dev and user adoption by just making address naming more relatable.
the plan is well detailled and explained which is a very good point , the project manager seems to have the backgrounds to be able to achieve his goals.
it is hard to tell the amount requested is relatively high and maybe the project should be broken into smaller funding rounds to assess if the development is delivering and timely
This proposal includes no budget breakdown, no metrics or implementation KPI's or developer resources identified.
Phils experience and the quality of the proposal and the existence of a team with a modest and realistic bid suggest high likeliehood of success.

Nowhere does the proposer provide detail that makes it clear what their previous experience implementing similar solutions is. In addition the proposal has a project plan lacking detail and a vague timeframe with no benchmarks, metrics or real development plan identified.
Budget and timeframes are loose and the deliverables are shaky with no true metrics/KPI's included in this

I am familiar with the proposers experience and background and the project timeline is realistic. The reliance on Atala teams to deliver is concerning and would like to see contingency plans to continue implementing DARP with another solution if needed.

the information is clear and well détailled , i just have a small concern about security, the author adress some solutions to secure his ideas (i don't have the background to judge it) just telling that it should be bulletproof.
plenty of depth on the information provided to state the use case argument

This proposal is 1. not a developer tool and 2. is a plugin that can be built into Atala Prism. The proposer also fails to include a budget but is requesting one of the largest of any proposal in the dev ecosystem challenge.
As always more detail will be welcome but for this stage the proposal is sufficiently detailed to understand that it clearly addresses the challenge.

There are key points missing in this proposal: cardinal amongst these is the fact this protocol does is for Cardano users and not developers and the proposer has no plan to mitigate the clear dependency risk on Atala Prism (a closed source product) timeframe

The technical "work in progress" whitepaper is promising and seems to be sufficient information to understand how this proposal will directly benefit the dev ecosystem. Many dapp ideas would require a solution like this to succeed.

solution: The Decentralised Address Resolution Protocol (DARP) builds on Atala PRISM's foundations to allow easy to remember address names to be used.
